result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs 7.31.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 7.31.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Entry of October 22, 2015 made in error.

Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Jury Trial and final pretrial date requested.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS CONSECUTIVE,  the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs 7.31.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 7.31.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 08:30 am.
Order To Produce Transport
Plea Hearing on Monday, April 27, at 8:30 AM in BR 7, CH Rm 629 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 03-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 5, 2015 received and filed. kl

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 03-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in court, in custody with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF4578 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Jose Viera-MPD Officer.      State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  
  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in custody.  David Behm for Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, officer is not available for today's proceedings.  Defense motion to dismiss is denied at this time.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Jonathan Edwin Rock in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
